trans-unit.source: Draws one or more Bezier curves

seg-source.mrk: Draws one or more Bezier curves

target.mrk: Draws one or more Bezier curves

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to a device context.
The 2D array ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], ... [xN, yN]) that contains the endpoints and control points of the

seg-source.mrk: [xN, yN]) that contains the endpoints and control points of the

target.mrk: [xN, yN]) that contains the endpoints and control points of the

trans-unit.source: curve(s), in logical units. The number of points must be three times the number of curves to be drawn,

seg-source.mrk: The number of points must be three times the number of curves to be drawn,

target.mrk: The number of points must be three times the number of curves to be drawn,

trans-unit.source: because each Bezier curve requires two control points and an ending point.

seg-source.mrk: because each Bezier curve requires two control points and an ending point.

target.mrk: because each Bezier curve requires two control points and an ending point.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array to start drawing at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to start drawing at.

target.mrk: The index of array to start drawing at.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array to stop drawing at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to stop drawing at.

target.mrk: The index of array to stop drawing at.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
True
False
Remarks
This function draws cubic Bezier curves by using the control points specified by the $aPoint parameter.

seg-source.mrk: This function draws cubic Bezier curves by using the control points specified by the $aPoint parameter.

target.mrk: This function draws cubic Bezier curves by using the control points specified by the $aPoint parameter.

trans-unit.source: The first curve is drawn from the current position to the third point by using the first two points as control points.

seg-source.mrk: The first curve is drawn from the current position to the third point by using the first two points as control points.

target.mrk: The first curve is drawn from the current position to the third point by using the first two points as control points.

trans-unit.source: For each subsequent curve, the function needs exactly three more points, and uses the ending point of the previous

seg-source.mrk: For each subsequent curve, the function needs exactly three more points, and uses the ending point of the previous

target.mrk: For each subsequent curve, the function needs exactly three more points, and uses the ending point of the previous

trans-unit.source: curve as the starting point for the next.

seg-source.mrk: curve as the starting point for the next.

target.mrk: curve as the starting point for the next.

trans-unit.source: The current position moves to the ending point of the last Bezier curve. The figure is not filled.

seg-source.mrk: The current position moves to the ending point of the last Bezier curve.

target.mrk: The current position moves to the ending point of the last Bezier curve.

trans-unit.source: This function draws lines by using the current pen.

seg-source.mrk: This function draws lines by using the current pen.

target.mrk: This function draws lines by using the current pen.
